content: diagonal waves cloth an easy knit cotton cloth based on the chinese waves pattern but knit diagonally so you can use any yarn and knit it until it is the size you want great for faces dishes cleaning cotton or bamboo yarn is recommended for cloths but you can use wool / acrylic or a blend too and make squares for blankets i originally posted this pattern to the knitlist in 1996 back then knitters all over the world communicated via this email list i lost the pattern but recently discovered it in the knitlist archives i have made some adjustments and corrected some errors that were in the original pattern http //web archive org/web/20080516030022/http //www knitlist co m/96gift/giftdiagcloth htm materials & equipment for cloths dk 8 ply or worsted 10 ply in cotton or bamboo is recommended weigh your yarn and work the cloth until it is the size you want or until you have used up half the weight and then start your decreases suggested needles for yarn weight 8 ply - 4 mm 10 ply - 4 5 - 5 mm sizing the lilac sample used 25 g 60 m of 8 ply heirloom cotton knitted on 4 mm needles and measured 20 cm x 20 cm the blue sample used 50 g 87m of sugar n cream cotton 10 ply knitted on 5 mm needles and made a large cloth approximately 25 cm x 25 cm abbreviations k - knit p - purl st - stitch or stitches yf - yarn forward bring yarn to front of needle before knitting next stitch k2tog - knit two stitches together ©heathermaid 2019 v2 updated 10/2020 page 2 of 3 instructions cast on 4 sts knit 2 row slipping the first st next row slip 1 k1 yf knit to end repeat this row until you have 7 sts if you don t want the eyelet holes along the edge replace all yf with a lifted increase or knit into the back of the yf on the next row begin waves pattern increase row 1 slip 1 k1 yf k1 slip 1 purlwise with yarn at back repeat until you get to the last 3 sts then knit to end increase row 2 slip 1 k1 yf knit to end repeat the last 2 row until the side measures desired length ending with an increase row 2 begin decreases decrease row 1 slip 1 k2tog yf k2tog slip 1 purlwise with yarn at back k1 repeat until you get to the last 2 sts - knit to end decrease row 2 slip 1 k2tog yf k2tog knit to end repeat the last 2 row until 7 sts remain then work as follows slip1 k2tog yf k2tog k to end repeat this row until 5 st remain slip1 k2tog knit to end 4 st cast off but knit the 2nd and 3rd stitches together as you do sew in ends ©heathermaid 2019 v2 updated 10/2020 page 3 of 3
